questions.question: Impulse response is due to intial excitation with high magnitude acting for a short period of time

explanations.a: Correct, the right answer is (a). Impulse response is due to intial excitation with high magnitude acting for a short period of time. It characterizes how a system responds to a Dirac delta function (an idealized impulse) input. In the time domain, the impulse response represents the system’s behavior over time after the excitation. In the frequency domain, it provides insights into the system’s natural frequencies and modes of vibration.
